body_html:
I found a way to fix my problem. I'm not sure it's right way...

I added my gcc header file path to third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL file.

  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/opt/rh/devtoolset-2/root/usr/include"
  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/opt/rh/devtoolset-2/root/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.2/include"

I guess that my problem was due to using another version of gcc that was not installed in system directory.
If same problem, it may work...

body:
I found a way to fix my problem. I'm not sure it's right way... I added my gcc header file path to third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL file. 
  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/opt/rh/devtoolset-2/root/usr/include"
  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/opt/rh/devtoolset-2/root/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.2/include"
I guess that my problem was due to using another version of gcc that was not installed in system directory. If same problem, it may work...
